Getting Started

Prerequisites

Publisher Pipeline requires a Java JDK to be installed. Publisher Pipeline ships with its own Groovy library, therefore no Groovy needs to be installed. Any existing Groovy installation is ignored by Publisher Pipeline. The standard Publisher Pipeline distribution requires a JDK 1.6 or higher.

Publisher Pipeline uses whichever JDK it finds in your path (to check, use java -version). Alternatively, you can set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to point to the install directory of the desired JDK.

Download

You can download one of the Publisher Pipeline distributions from the Publisher Pipeline web site.

Unpacking

The Publisher Pipeline distribution comes packaged as a ZIP. The full distribution contains:

  • The Publisher Pipeline binaries.

  • The user guide.

  • The API documentation (Javadoc and Groovydoc).

  • Extensive samples, including the examples referenced in the user guide, along with some complete and more complex builds you can use the starting point for your own build.

  • The binary sources (If you want to build Publisher Pipeline you need to download the source distribution or checkout the sources from the source repository).

For Un*x users

You need a GNU compatible tool to unzip Publisher Pipeline, if you want the file permissions to be properly set. We mention this as some zip front ends for Mac OS X don't restore the file permissions properly.

Running and testing your installation

You run Publisher Pipeline via the gradle command. To check if Publisher Pipeline is properly installed just type gradle -v and you should get an output like: 

------------------------------------------------------------
Publisher Pipeline 0.8
------------------------------------------------------------

Publisher Pipeline buildtime: Monday, September 28, 2009 1:53:43 PM CEST
Groovy: 1.6.4
Ant: Apache Ant version 1.7.0 compiled on December 13 2006
Ivy: 2.1.0-rc2
Java: 1.6.0_15
JVM: 14.1-b02-90
JVM Vendor: Apple Inc.
OS Name: Mac OS X

JVM options

JVM options for running Publisher Pipeline can be set via the JAVA_OPTSenvironment variable. Those variables can be used together. JAVA_OPTS is by convention an environment variable shared by many Java applications. This variable can also be set at the beginning of the pub or pub.bat scripts.

Getting help

You might check the user guide at GRADLE_HOME/docs/userguide/userguide.html. It is also available on the Publisher Pipeline web site. Typing pub -help prints the command line help.

Contact Information

If you have any suggestions for improvements, would like to point out issues, congratulate or require assistance feel free to contact me Leanne Northrop at dawn.flowerdew@googlemail.com.
